pullRequest.body:
In this PR, we define the single functors from a preadditive category (with a zero object) to its homotopy category of cochain complexes and show they behave well with respect to shift functors.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### Import summary

No significant changes to the import graph
Judging by the comments in the code, I have marked this `WIP`.
Now this is ready for review.

> I think `simps` can generate some useful lemmas?

Actually, in most (future) situations, we do not want these definitions to be unfolded. These are almost like blackboxes which give an additional structure on these categories.
Gotcha. Can you record this in the docstring?
I have just added a comment.

### PR summary

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ instance (W : Type*) [Category W] [Preadditive W] [HasZeroObject W] [DecidableEq Î¹] (j : Î¹) :`
`+ instance (j : Î¹) : (single V c j).PreservesZeroMorphisms`
`+ instance (n : â„¤) : ((singleFunctors C).functor n).Additive`
`+ instance (n : â„¤) : (singleFunctor C n).Additive`
`+ singleFunctorPostcompQuotientIso`
`+ singleFunctorsPostcompQuotientIso`
`++ singleFunctors`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

Thanks!

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
I think `simps` can generate some useful lemmas?

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

I don't think this is what you meant?
Or maybe even `irreducible_def` if you are 100% sure.
I have fixed the phrasing. (`irreducible_def` would be too much.)

So this is `defeq` to `single _ _ n` but this is the main API and not `single` right?
I think it is useful to document these things. (This is what I meant above)
Thanks for the suggestion.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: the single functors from the homotopy category

source.title: feat: definition of Ext-groups as morphisms in the derived category
